results.title: The Cruel sea
results.creator_credit: Charles Frend, Leslie Norman and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A powerful moving documentary-style account of life on board a British warship during World War II. It is the courageous story of the battle of the Atlantic, a story of ocean, a shipand a handful of men. The only villain is the sea, that man and war have made even more brutal. Based on the novel by Nicholas Monsarrat and stars Jack Hawkins, Donald Sinden, Denholm Elliot and Virginia McKenna.

results.title: School for scoundrels
results.creator_credit: Robert Hamer, Hal E. Chester, Guardsman Film Productions and ABP
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
Amusing British comedy about a constant “loser” (Ian Carmichael) who enrols in Alistair Sim’s School of Lifemanship” and there learns all the tricks to allow him to win the girl and get the better of two unscrupulous used car salesmen (Dennis Price and Peter Jones) as well as his rival in love and on the tennis court, Terry Thomas. Based on the book by Stephen Potter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Hamer, Hal E. Chester, Guardsman Film Productions and ABP

results.title: The Lavender Hill Mob
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Truman and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
This comedy stars Alec Guinness as an underpaid bank clerk who plans and executes a gold robbery but his colleagues’ attempt to hide the loot leads to bizarre and suspenseful complications. Also features Stanley Holloway and Sidney James. Won Academy award for Best story and screenplay.

results.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
results.creator_credit: Robert Hamer, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A genteel mass-murderer is out to heartlessly eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and the family fortune. Alec Guinness plays all eight victims in this witty black comedy. Based on the novel “Noblesse oblige” by Roy Horniman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Hamer, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios

results.title: Richard Lowenstein on the making of 'Strikebound'
results.brief_description:

Peter Thompson interviews Richard Lowenstein on the production of his feature film “Strikebound”.

results.title: Gill Armstrong
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Film Makers”.
Michael Carlton interviews Australian film-maker Gillian Armstrong about her motivations for making films, and discusses some of her productions, in particular “My brilliant career”.

group_works.title: Lenses and perspective: how does it look from where you are?
Shot sizes and framing faults: Episode 2

results.title: Rhythm
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Devised and narrated by Peter Thompson. Explores rhythm as a fundamental part of the langauge of motion pictures and its integral role in film making. Addresses: 1. Rhythm does not depend on cutting 2. Changes of shot do not necessarily have any special rhythmic effect 3. Music can impose its own rhythm 4. Music and images can work together.

results.title: Rhythm (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Devised and narrated by Peter Thompson. Explores rhythm as a fundamental part of the language of motion pictures and its integral role in film making. Addresses: 1. Rhythm does not depend on cutting 2. Changes of shot do not necessarily have any special rhythmic effect 3. Music can impose its own rhythm 4. Music and images can work together. No other credits available.
